intro: Hieracium aphyllopodioides, commonly known as the slender leaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and roadsides. Its leaves are narrow and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are small and yellow. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological and morphological traits.
